interface.name: treeland_output_manager_v1

description.summary: expose which is the primary display

interface.description: Protocol for telling which is the primary display among the selection of enabled outputs.

description.summary: Select which primary output to use

event.name: primary_output

description.summary: Provide the current primary output's name

event.description: Specifies which output is the primary one identified by their name.

description.summary: Get color control interface for output.

interface.name: treeland_output_color_control_v1
interface.description: Protocol for controlling color temperature and brightness settings of a specific output.

event.name: color_temperature
event.description: Provides the current color temperature setting of the output. Color temperature settings maps the white point of the display to a specific temperature in Kelvin. Typical value ranges are between 4000K (warm) to 10000K (cool), with 6600K being neutral. Treeland supports color temperature adjustment within 1500K to 15000K. This event is sent once after the treeland_output_color_control_v1 object is created, or right after a set_color_temperature request finishes successfully.

event.name: brightness
event.description: Provides the current brightness setting of the output. Brightness is valued in the range [0.0, 1.0]. This event is sent once after the treeland_output_color_control_v1 object is created, or right after a set_brightness request finishes successfully.
